metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1945 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unexpected data returned from the Safe Browsing API could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.10 and Firefox ESR < 102.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1945` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
